name: Death of the Phoenix
description:
A simple game (as my time was extremely limited) for the GameDev.tv Jam. Click to play through the story with combat  being menu driven. Each attack has a different cost in stamina and the damage it does to enemies. The color of the enemy name indicates their approximate health  with green being good, yellow indicating damaged, and red for near death. You can restore stamina by defending which also reduces (or eliminates for some monsters) damage.

Some of the art for the game is creative commons or open source as follows:

Phoenix by Friedrich Johann Justin Bertuch (1747–1822) public domain

Cinnamon tree by Augustus Binu under Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 3.0.

Resin extruding from trunk of mature Araucaria Columnaris by  Kumar83 under Creative Commons Attribution 3.0

1024px-Apis_mellifera_scutellata by Jeffrey W. Lotz, Florida Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services, Bugwood.org Creative Commons Attribution 3.0

AbuGhurabSunNiuserre.jpg by Roland Unger Creative Commons Attribution 3.0
